register.description: This register contains the IP revision code.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
IP revision[7:4]Major revision[3:0]Minor revision

register.description: This register allows the control of various parameters of the interconnect interface.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Master interface power management, standby/waitcontrol

bitenum.description: Force standby. MStandby is asserted only when the module is disabled.
No standby: MStandby is never asserted.
Smart Standby. MStandby is asserted based on the internal activity of the module.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Clock activity during wakeup mode period

bitenum.description: interface and functional clocks can be switched off.
Functional clocks can be switched off and interface clocks are maintained during wakeup period.
Interface clocks can be switched off and functional clocks are maintained during wakeup period.
Interface and functional clocks are maintained during wakeup period.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Slave interface power management, idle req/ack control

bitenum.description: Force idle. An idle request is acknowledged unconditionally.
No idle. An idle request is never acknowledged.
Smart idle. Idle request is acknowledged based on the internal activity of the module.

bitfield.description: Wakeup feature control
Software reset. Set this bit to 1 to trigger a module reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. During reads, it always returns 0.
Internal interface clock gating strategy

bitenum.description: Automatic L3 and L4 interface clock gating strategy is applied based on interface activity.

register.description: This register provides status information about the module, excluding interrupt status information.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Reserved. Read returns 0.
Internal reset monitoring

register.description: This register regroups all the status of module internal events that generate an interrupt. A write of 1 to a given bit resets the bit.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0

register.description: This register allows the masking/unmasking of module internal interrupt sources, on an event-by-event basis.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Wakeup mask

bitenum.description: Wakeup generates an interrupt when it occurs.
SyncLostDigital generates an interrupt when it occurs.
SyncLost generates an interrupt when it occurs.
Vid2EndWindow generates an interrupt when it occurs.
Vid2FIFOUnderflow generates an interrupt when it occurs.
EndVid1Window generates an interrupt when it occurs.
Vid1FIFOUnderflow generates an interrupt when it occurs.
OCPError generates an interrupt when it occurs.
PaletteGammaMask generates an interrupt when it occurs.
GfxEndWindow generates an interrupt when it occurs.
GfxFIFOUnderflow generates an interrupt when it occurs.
ProgrammedLineNumber generates an interrupt when it occurs.
ACBiasCountStatus generates an interrupt when it occurs.
EVSYNC_ODD generates an interrupt when it occurs.
EVSYNC_EVEN generates an interrupt when it occurs.
VSYNC generates an interrupt when it occurs.
FrameMask generates an interrupt when it occurs.

register.description: The control register configures the display controller module.

bitfield.description: Spatial/Temporal dithering number of frameswr: VFP

bitenum.description: Spatial and temporal over two frames
Spatial and temporal over four frames

bitfield.description: LCD Enable Signal Polarity
LCD Enable Signal: LCD interface active/inactive
Pixel clock free-running enabled/disabled
State of unused bits (TDM mode only)WR: VFP
Cycle format (TDM mode only)WR: VFP
Output Interface width (TDM mode only)WR: VFP
Enable the multiple cycle format (TDM mode used only for Active Matrix mode with the RFBI enable bit off).WR: VFP
Hold Time for digital outputWR: EVSYNCEncoded value (from 0 to 7) holds time for digital output. The data will be held for (HT + 1) external digital clock periods.
General Purpose Output Signal
General Purpose Output Signal
General Purpose Input SignalWR: VFP
General Purpose Input SignalWR: VFP
Overlay Optimization (available when graphics format is NOT is 1-, 2, and 4-BPP)WR: VFP or EVSYNC

bitenum.description: Graphics data below video1 window fetched from memory or no overlap between graphics and video1 windows.
Graphics data below video1 window not fetched from memory.

bitfield.description: Stall mode for the LCD outputwr: VFP

bitenum.description: Stall mode selected. The Display Controller sends the data without considering the VSYNC/HSYNC. The LCD output is disabled at the end of the transfer of the frame. The S/W has to re-enable the LCD output to generate a new frame. The stall mode is used in RFBI and DSI command modes.

bitfield.description: Reserved for non-GP devices
Number of lines of the LCD interfaceWR: VFP

bitenum.description: 12-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
16-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
18-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
24-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface

bitfield.description: Spatial temporal dithering enableWR: VFP
Digital GO Command

bitenum.description: The hardware has finished updating the internal shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the digital output using the user values. The hardware resets the bit when the update is completed.
Users have finished programming the shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the digital output and the hardware can update the internal registers at the external VSYNC.

bitfield.description: LCD GO Command

bitenum.description: The hardware has finished updating the internal shadow registers of the pipeline(s) connected to the LCD output using the user values. The hardware resets the bit when the update is completed.
Users have finished programming the shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the LCD output and the hardware can update the internal registers at the VFP start period.

bitfield.description: Mono 8-bit modeWR: VFP

bitenum.description: Pixel data [3:0] is used to output four pixel values to the panel at each pixel clock transition (only in Passive Mono 8-bit mode).
Pixel data [7:0] is used to output eight pixel values to the panel each pixel clock transition (only in Passive Mono 8-bit mode).

bitfield.description: LCD display typeWR: VFP

bitenum.description: Passive or Passive Matrix display operation enabled. Passive Matrix dither logic enabled.
Active Matrix display operation enabled. Passive Matrix Dither logic and output FIFO bypassed.

bitfield.description: Monochrome/ColorWR: VFP

bitenum.description: Color operation enabled (Passive Matrix mode only)
Monochrome operation enabled (Passive Matrix mode only)

bitfield.description: Digital enable

bitenum.description: Digital output disabled (at the end of the current field if interlace output when the bit is reset)

bitfield.description: LCD enable

bitenum.description: LCD output disabled (at the end of the frame when the bit is reset)

register.description: This control register configures the display controller module.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Selects the alpha blender (TV output)
Selects the alpha blender (LCD output)
Controls if the FIFO are refilled only when the LOW threshold is reached or if all FIFO are refilled when at least one of them reaches the LOW threshold.

bitenum.description: Each FIFO is refilled when it reaches LOW threshold.

All FIFOs are refilled up to high threshold when at least one of them reaches the LOW threshold. (only active FIFOs should be considered and when reaching the end of the frame the FIFO goes to empty condition so no need to fill it again).

bitfield.description: Controls the handshake between FIFO and RFBI STALL to prevent from underflow. The bit should be set to 0 when the module is not in STALL mode.

bitenum.description: Only the STALL signal from RFBI is used regardless of the FIFO fullness information to provide data to the RFBI module.
The STALL signal from RFBI is used in combination with the FIFO fullness information to provide data to the RFBI module only when it does not generated FIFO underflow.

bitfield.description: Color phase rotation control wr: VFP
FIFO merge controlwr: EVSYNC or VFP

bitenum.description: FIFO merge disabledEach FIFO is dedicated to one pipeline.
FIFO merge enabledAll the FIFOS are merged into a single one to be used by the single active pipeline.

bitfield.description: Transparency color key selection (digital output)wr: EVSYNC

bitenum.description: Graphics destination transparency color key selected in normal mode or graphics source transparency color key selected in alpha mode
Video source transparency color key selected in normal mode

bitfield.description: Transparency color key enabled (digital output)wr: EVSYNC

bitenum.description: Disable the transparency color key for digital output
Enable the transparency color key for digital output

bitfield.description: Transparency color key selection (LCD output)WR: VFP

bitenum.description: Graphics destination transparency color key selected in normal mode or graphics source transparency color key selected in alpha mode
Video source transparency color key selected in normal mode

bitfield.description: Transparency color key enabled (LCD output)WR: VFP *

bitenum.description: Disable the transparency color key for the LCD
Enable the transparency color key for the LCD

bitfield.description: Functional clocks gated enabledWR: immediate
ACBias Gated EnabledWR: VFP
VSYNC Gated EnabledWR: VFP
HSYNC Gated EnabledWR: VFP
Pixel Clock Gated EnabledWR: VFP
Pixel Data Gated EnabledWR: VFP
Palette/Gamma Table selectionWR: EVSYNC or VFP

bitenum.description: LUT used as palette (only if graphics format is BITMAP1, 2, 4, and 8)
LUT used as gamma table (only if graphics format is NOT BITMAP1, 2, 4, and 8 or no graphics window present)

bitfield.description: Loading Mode for the Palette/Gamma TableWR: EVSYNC or VFP

bitenum.description: Palette/Gamma Table and data are loaded every frame.
Palette/Gamma Table to be loaded. Users set the bit when the palette/gamma table has to be loaded. H/W resets the bit when table has been loaded. (. GfxEnable has to be set to 1).
Frame data only loaded every frame
Palette/Gamma Table and frame data loaded on first frame then switch to 10 (H/W).

bitfield.description: Pixel Gated Enable (only for Active Matrix Display)WR: VFP

bitenum.description: Pixel clock always toggles (only in Active Matrix mode)
Pixel clock only toggles when there is valid data to display. (only in Active Matrix mode)

register.description: The control register allows to configure the default solid background color for the LCD (DISPC_DEFAULT_COLOR_0) and for 24-bit digital output (DISPC_DEFAULT_COLOR_1).Shadow register, updated on VFP start period for DISPC_DEFAULT_COLOR_0 and EVSYNC for DISPC_DEFAULT_COLOR_1

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
24-bit RGB color value to specify the default solid color to display when there is no data from the overlays.

register.description: The control register allows to configure the default solid background color for the LCD (DISPC_DEFAULT_COLOR_0) and for 24-bit digital output (DISPC_DEFAULT_COLOR_1).Shadow register, updated on VFP start period for DISPC_DEFAULT_COLOR_0 and EVSYNC for DISPC_DEFAULT_COLOR_1

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
24-bit RGB color value to specify the default solid color to display when there is no data from the overlays.

register.description: The register sets the transparency color value for the video/graphics overlays for the LCD output (DISPC_TRANS_COLOR_0) for 24-bit digital output(DISPC_TRANS_COLOR_1).Shadow register, updated on VFP start period for DISPC_TRANS_COLOR_0 and EVSYNC for DISPC_TRANS_COLOR_1

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0

Transparency Color Key Value in RGB format[0] BITMAP 1 (CLUT), [23,1] set to 0s[1:0] BITMAP 2 (CLUT), [23,2] set to 0s[3:0] BITMAP 4 (CLUT), [23,4] set to 0s[7:0] BITMAP 8 (CLUT), [23,8] set to 0s[11:0] RGB 12, [23,12] set to 0s[15:0] RGB 16, [23,16] set to 0s[23:0] RGB 24

register.description: The register sets the transparency color value for the video/graphics overlays for the LCD output (DISPC_TRANS_COLOR_0) for 24-bit digital output(DISPC_TRANS_COLOR_1).Shadow register, updated on VFP start period for DISPC_TRANS_COLOR_0 and EVSYNC for DISPC_TRANS_COLOR_1

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0

Transparency Color Key Value in RGB format[0] BITMAP 1 (CLUT), [23,1] set to 0s[1:0] BITMAP 2 (CLUT), [23,2] set to 0s[3:0] BITMAP 4 (CLUT), [23,4] set to 0s[7:0] BITMAP 8 (CLUT), [23,8] set to 0s[11:0] RGB 12, [23,12] set to 0s[15:0] RGB 16, [23,16] set to 0s[23:0] RGB 24

register.description: The control register indicates the current LCD panel display line number.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
Current LCD panel line numberCurrent display line number. The first active line has the value 0. During blanking lines the line number is not incremented.

register.description: The control register indicates the LCD panel display line number for the interrupt and the DMA request.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
LCD panel line number programmingLCD line number defines the line on which the programmable interrupt is generated and the DMA request occurs.

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the HSYNC signal.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: Horizontal Back Porch.Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the beginning of a line transmission before the first set of pixels is output to the display (program to value minus 1).
Horizontal front porch.Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the end of a line transmission before line clock is asserted (program to value minus 1).
Horizontal synchronization pulse widthEncoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to pulse the line clock at the end of each line (program to value minus 1).

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the VSYNC signal.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: Vertical back porchEncoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the beginning of a frame before the first set of pixels is output to the display.
Vertical front porchEncoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the end of each frame.

Vertical synchronization pulse widthIn active mode, encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of line clock periods (program to value minus one) to pulse the frame clock (VSYNC) pin at the end of each frame after the end of frame wait (VFP) period elapses. Frame clock uses as VSYNC signal in active mode.In passive mode, encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of extra line clock periods (program to value minus one) to insert after the vertical front porch (VFP) period has elapsed.

register.description: The register configures the signal configuration.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
HSYNC/VSYNC Pixel clock Control On/Off

bitenum.description: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on opposite edges of pixel clock than pixel data
HSYNC and VSYNC are driven according to bit 16

bitfield.description: Program HSYNC/VSYNC Rise or Fall

bitenum.description: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on falling edge of pixel clock (if bit 17 set to 1)
HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on the rising edge of pixel clock (if bit 17 set to 1)

bitfield.description: Invert output enable

bitenum.description: Ac-bias is active high (active display mode)
Ac-bias is active low (active display mode)

bitfield.description: Invert pixel clock

bitenum.description: Data is driven on the LCD data lines on the rising-edge of the pixel clock
Data is driven on the LCD data lines on the falling-edge of the pixel clock

bitfield.description: Invert HSYNC

bitenum.description: Line clock pin is active high and inactive low
Line clock pin is active low and inactive high

bitfield.description: Invert VSYNC

bitenum.description: Frame clock pin is active high and inactive low
Frame clock pin is active low and inactive high

bitfield.description: AC-bias pin transitions per interruptValue (from 0 to 15) used to specify the number of AC Bias pin transitions

AC-bias pin frequencyValue (from 0 to 255) used to specify the number of line clocks to count before transitioning the ac-bias pin. This pin is used to periodically invert the polarity of the power supply to prevent DC charge build-up within the display.

register.description: The register configures the divisors.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
Display Controller Logic Clock DivisorValue (from 1 to 255) to specify the frequency of the display controller logic clock based on the function clock. The value 0 is invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
Pixel Clock DivisorValue (from 1 to 255) to specify the frequency of the pixel clock based on the Logic clock which is the functional clock divided by LCD. The values 0 and 1 are invalid.

register.description: The register defines the global alpha value for the graphics and video 2 pipelines. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC for each bit field depending on the association of the each pipeline with the LCD or TV output.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads return 0
Global alpha value from 0 to 255. 0 corresponds to fully transparent and 255 to fully opaque.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads return 0
Global alpha value from 0 to 255. 0 corresponds to fully transparent and 255 to fully opaque.

register.description: The register configures the size of the digital output field (interlace), frame (progressive) (horizontal and vertical).Shadow register, updated on EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
Lines per panel Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of lines per panel (program to value minus one).
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
Pixels per lineEncoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels contained within each line on the display (program to value minus one)

register.description: The register configures the panel size (horizontal and vertical).Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
Lines per panelEncoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of lines per panel (program to value minus one).
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0

Pixels per lineEncoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels contains within each line on the display (program to value minus one). When running in normal mode (stall mode is bypassed by setting DSS.DISPC_CONTROL[11] STALLMODE =0) the line width must be set to a value multiple of 8 pixels (ex: PPL=0x7)

register.description: The register configures the base address of the graphics buffer displayed in the graphics window (0 & 1 :for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity, 0 only used when graphics pipeline on the LCD output and 0 & 1 when on the 24-bit digital output).Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Graphics base addressBase address of the graphics buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary) (in case 1-, 2-, and 4-BPP, byte alignment is required)

register.description: The register configures the base address of the graphics buffer displayed in the graphics window (0 & 1 :for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity, 0 only used when graphics pipeline on the LCD output and 0 & 1 when on the 24-bit digital output).Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Graphics base addressBase address of the graphics buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary) (in case 1-, 2-, and 4-BPP, byte alignment is required)

register.description: The register configures the position of the graphics window.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
Y position of the graphics window.Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the Y position of the graphics window on the screen. The line at the top has the Y-position 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
X position of the graphics window.Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the X position of the graphics window on the screen. The first pixel on the left of the screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the size of the graphics window.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of lines of the graphics window.Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of lines of the graphics window (program to value minus one).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of pixels of the graphics window.Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels per line of the graphics window (program to value minus one).

register.description: The register configures the graphics attributes.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
Enables the self refresh of the graphics window from its own FIFO only.

bitenum.description: The graphics pipeline accesses the interconnect to fetch data from the system memory
The graphics pipeline does not need anymore to fetch data from memory. Only the graphics FIFO is used. It takes effect after the frame has been loaded in the FIFO

bitfield.description: Determines the priority of the graphics pipeline. The graphics pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline. The arbitration wheel gives always the priority first to the high priority pipelines using round-robin between them. When there is only normal priority pipelines sending requests, the round-robin applies between them.

bitenum.description: The graphics pipeline is one of the normal priority pipeline.
The graphics pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline.

bitfield.description: Graphics rotation flag (used only in case of RGB24 packed format)
Graphics preload value

bitenum.description: H/W prefetches pixels up to the preload value defined in the preload register.
H/W prefetches pixels up to high threshold value.

bitfield.description: Graphics endianness
Graphics Nibble Mode (only for 1-, 2- and 4-BPP)
Graphics Channel Out configurationwr: immediate
Graphics DMA Burst Size
Graphics format; Other enums: Reserved(0x7, 0xA, 0xB and 0xF)

bitenum.description: RGBx 32 (24-bit RGB aligned on MSB of the 32-bit container)
Graphics disabled (graphics pipeline inactive and graphics window not present)
Graphics enabled (graphics pipeline active and graphics window present on the screen)

register.description: The register configures the graphics FIFO.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Graphics FIFO High ThresholdNumber of bytes defining the threshold value.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Graphics FIFO Low ThresholdNumber of bytes defining the threshold value

register.description: This register defines the graphics FIFO size.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
Graphics FIFO SizeNumber of bytes defining the FIFO value.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the rowEncoded signed value (from -2- 1 to 2) to specify the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row in the graphics buffer.The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1+n*BPP means increment of n pixels. The value 1- (n+1)*BPP means decrement of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment between two pixels.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0

Number of bytes to increment between two pixelsEncoded signed value (from -2- 1 to 2) to specify the number of bytes between two pixels in the graphics buffer.The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1+n*BPP means increment of n pixels. The value 1- (n+1)*BPP means decrement of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to skip during video window display.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to skip during video window #1.Encoded signed value (from -2-1 to 2) to specify the number of bytes to skip in the graphics buffer when video window #1 is displayed on top of the graphics and no transparency color is enabled.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the palette buffer or the gamma table buffer.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Base address of the palette/gamma table buffer (24-bit entries in 32-bit containers, aligned on 32-bit boundary).

register.description: The control register configures the output data format for ith (1st, 2nd or 3rd) cycle.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
Bit alignmentAlignment of the bits from pixel#2 on the output interface
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of bitsNumber of bits from the pixel #2 (value from 0 to 16 bits). The values from 17 to 31 are invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Bit alignmentAlignment of the bits from pixel#1 on the output interface
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of bitsNumber of bits from the pixel #1 (value from 0 to 16 bits). The values from 17 to 31 are invalid.

register.description: The control register configures the output data format for ith (1st, 2nd or 3rd) cycle.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
Bit alignmentAlignment of the bits from pixel#2 on the output interface
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of bitsNumber of bits from the pixel #2 (value from 0 to 16 bits). The values from 17 to 31 are invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Bit alignmentAlignment of the bits from pixel#1 on the output interface
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of bitsNumber of bits from the pixel #1 (value from 0 to 16 bits). The values from 17 to 31 are invalid.

register.description: The control register configures the output data format for ith (1st, 2nd or 3rd) cycle.Shadow register, updated on VFP start period.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0
Bit alignmentAlignment of the bits from pixel#2 on the output interface
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of bitsNumber of bits from the pixel #2 (value from 0 to 16 bits). The values from 17 to 31 are invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Bit alignmentAlignment of the bits from pixel#1 on the output interface
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of bitsNumber of bits from the pixel #1 (value from 0 to 16 bits). The values from 17 to 31 are invalid.

register.description: This register configures the color phase rotation matrix coefficients for the red component. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period.

bitfield.description: RR coefficientEncoded signed value (from -512 to 511)
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
RG coefficientEncoded signed value (from -512 to 511)
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
RB coefficientEncoded signed value (from -512 to 511)

register.description: This register configures the color phase rotation matrix coefficients for the green component. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period.

bitfield.description: GR coefficientEncoded signed value (from -512 to 511)
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
GG coefficientEncoded signed value (from -512 to 511)
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
GB coefficientEncoded signed value (from -512 to 511)

register.description: This register configures the color phase rotation matrix coefficients for the blue component. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period.

bitfield.description: BR coefficientEncoded signed value (from -512 to 511)
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
BG coefficientEncoded signed value (from -512 to 511)
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
BB coefficientEncoded signed value (from -512 to 511)

register.description: This register configures the graphics FIFO. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Graphics preload value: Number of bytes defining the preload value.
